alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Northampton; Upper Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hunterdon, southwestern Warren, southeastern Lehigh, northwestern Bucks and southeastern Northampton Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hellertown, or 7 miles southeast of Allentown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Wilson, Hellertown, Alpha, Ferndale, Frenchtown, West Easton, Milford, Bloomsbury, Riegelsville, Steuben, Glendon, Pleasant Valley, Revere, Lehigh University, Ottsville, Springtown and Erwinna. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 45 and 48. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 60 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
